public class HeadingExtractor
extends java.lang.Object

An extractor for html headings.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_HEADING_TAGS

public static final java.lang.String[] DEFAULT_HEADING_TAGS
Any text found under these tags are considered headings.

VALUE_TO_STRENGTH

public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> VALUE_TO_STRENGTH
Default mappings from heading values to heading 'strength':

h h1 h2 h3 h4 h5 h6

size-N 6 5 4 3 2 1 0

size-% 200 150 120 100 80 70 60

hr thead th

em

strong

b

title strength 7 6 5 4 0 3 2 1

isUnder

public static final boolean isUnder(java.lang.Integer strengthToTest,
                                    java.lang.Integer baseStrength)
Determine whether the strength to test is under the base strength.

A strength is under another if it is strictly less than the other.

Note that 'null' is considered to be 'zero' and 'zero' is considered to be strictly less than 'zero'.

Returns:
true if the strengthToTest is 'under' the baseStrength.

extract

public java.util.List<Extraction> extract(DocText docText,
                                          java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean die)
Perform the extraction on the doc text.

Specified by:
extract in interface Extractor
Parameters:
docText - The docText to extract from.
die - Trigger to halt processing. Needs to be monitored and obeyed; but can also be set from within the implementation. Use with care!
Returns:
one or more extractions or null.
